conclusion: Determine the propagation time of light in the prism.
Determine the refractive index \( n \) of the prism material.
Calculate the path length of the light inside the prism.
Compute the propagation time using the speed of light in the prism.
Using Snell's Law at the first interface (AB): \( n \sin(i) = \sin(r_1) \) where \( i = 45^\circ \).
Assume the light exits directly perpendicular to the AC side after refraction at the second interface (BC), implying \( r_1 = 90^\circ - \theta/2 \).
Applying Snell's Law at the second interface (BC): \( n \sin(75^\circ) = \sin(45^\circ) \).
The distance OD is half the length of AB since O is the midpoint: \( OD = \frac{L}{2} \).
Calculate the path length inside the prism: \( s = \frac{L\sqrt{2}}{2} \).
The speed of light in the prism is \( v = \frac{C}{n} = \frac{C}{\sqrt{3} - 1} \).
